body: I just released 2.11.2 and don't see any problems with Dashboard.  Can you try that?

Same error.  I tried flushing redis, which didn't help.

On 1 May 2013 17:01, Mike Perham notifications@github.com wrote:

> I just released 2.11.2 and don't see any problems with Dashboard. Can you
> try that?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/issues/889#issuecomment-17306245
> .
I tried with some more data and everything still looks ok.  Do you have more of a backtrace?

This issue popped up today for me as well. Just the dashboard. I tried different versions.


Your slim gem is pretty old, try a newer version?

Yay! Looks like that did it.

I had to force slim to version 1.3.8 but it resolved the issue for me.

I'll try this also
On May 1, 2013 6:41 PM, "Jonathan Birkholz" notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Yay! Looks like that did it.
> 
> I had to force slim to version 1.3.8 but it resolved the issue for me.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/issues/889#issuecomment-17311057
> .
Yep, updating slim to 1.3.8 fixe the issue for me.  Not sure why bunder was using 1.0.1 though, my Gemfile doesn't specify a version and there are no gems depending on it to force a lower version...
Was experiencing the same -- and just wanted to report that the slim update to 1.3.8 fixed it for me, too.
Hi, I was experiencing the same issue, updating slim fixed, thanks!

The issue occurs because Slim 1.3.8 requires tilt (~> 1.3.6), and tilt 1.4.0 was released on 1st May 2013.

Gems that requires tilt e.g. sass-rails, haml will cause tilt 1.4.0 to be fetched, and bundler will install Slim 1.0.1 to satisfy the dependencies because Slim 1.0.1 requires tilt (~> 1.2), which is not as strict.

It is either we bump up the tilt version dependency by releasing Slim 1.3.9, or we'll have to force tilt to 1.3.x by explicitly specifying it in our Gemfile. I would prefer bumping up the version if it is not a problem.
Updating to Slim 1.3.8 solved this issue for me today..

Yep, guys you're right. 

Previously I was set up with Slim in the Gemfile without any version constraint which fetches the old version. Setting it to 

```
gem 'slim', ">= 1.3.0"
```

as per the wiki works perfectly.

@marclennox I have raised the issue about the slim installing old version issue separately on https://github.com/slim-template/slim/issues/396
Thanks, this bit me today too. Thanks for the investigation =)

Hey, maybe add this declaration to sidekiq? I mean `gem 'slim', '>= 1.3.8'`

I had the same problem.

Gemfile

``` ruby
gem 'rails', '4.0.0.rc1'
gem 'slim', '>= 1.3.0'
```

and error

```
Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem "tilt":
  In Gemfile:
    slim (>= 1.3.0) ruby depends on
      tilt (~> 1.3.3) ruby

    sass-rails (~> 4.0.0.beta1) ruby depends on
      tilt (1.4.0)
```
So the version check actually needs to be >= 1.3.8?
It works for me for 1.3.8
I think webui for sidekiq should be released as separate gem.
@sheerun Others have suggested the same.  It would require you to list two gems in your Gemfile and increase my maintenance costs.

If you love it, let it go ;) Maybe someone else would be interested in maintaining web ui. Just a suggestion.

@edit I also think sinatra, rack and slim should not be listed even as development dependencies. Sidekiq is sidekiq, UI is UI :)
